snippet: Three of Sahar Gul’s in-laws were each sentenced to 10 years in prison for inflicted painful injuries on the girl, including burning her scalp and pulling out some of her nails.
abstract: Afghan court sentences three relatives of Sahar Gul, 15-year-old girl whose case attracted widespread attention in 2011, to 10 years in prison for torturing Gul, including burning her scalp and pulling out some of her nails.
lead_paragraph: Three of Sahar Gul’s in-laws were each sentenced to 10 years in prison for inflicted painful injuries on the girl, including burning her scalp and pulling out some of her nails.

headline.seo: In-Laws Sentenced in Afghan Girl’s Torture Case
headline.main: In-Laws Sentenced in Afghan Girl’s Torture Case
headline.print_headline: In-Laws Sentenced to Prison In Afghan Girl’s Torture Case
